modules.description: Handles control messages for multimedia devices, supporting operations like setting volume, toggling mute, and managing playback state. Works with a list of message types and a device container to send commands to input/output devices. Used to control device behavior from an application, such as adjusting audio settings or handling window events.

This module defines message types for device-to-application communication, including buffer management and state change notifications. It provides a callback mechanism to handle messages like buffer overflow, underflow, and window buffer creation. Use this module to synchronize multimedia device events with application logic, such as managing audio volume changes or rendering video frames.

This module provides functions to enumerate and open audio/video input/output devices, supporting direct interaction with multimedia frameworks for capturing and rendering streams. It works with audio and video formats, containers, and device-specific options to configure and control device behavior. Concrete use cases include selecting a webcam or microphone for real-time capture, routing audio to specific output devices, and managing device-specific settings like interleaving and buffer options.
